array.string: “Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do.” - Mark Twain
“Motivation is a fire from within. If someone else tries to light that fire under you, chances are it will burn very briefly.” - Stephen R. Covey
“In three words I can sum up everything I’ve learned about life: It goes on.”- Robert Frost
“In any situation, the best thing you can do is the right thing; the next best thing you can do is the wrong thing; the worst thing you can do is nothing.”- Theodore Roosevelt
“I have not failed. I’ve just found 10,000 ways that won’t work.”- Thomas Edison
“In order to succeed, your desire for success should be greater than your fear of failure.”– Bill Cosby
“The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking. Don’t settle.”– Steve Jobs
“We don’t stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.”- George Bernard Shaw
“Life’s tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.”- Benjamin Franklin
“For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.”- Ralph Waldo Emerson
“He who angers you conquers you.”- Elizabeth Kenny
“You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger.”- Buddha
“You must be the change you wish to see in the world.”- Mahatma Gandhi
“The only thing constant in life is change.”- Francois de la Rochefoucauld
“Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.”- Buddha
“Money won’t create success. The freedom to make it will.”- Nelson Mandela
